title: Amanda Holden shares first photo of bandaged leg after surgery
text:
Poor Amanda’s holiday was ruined by the accident (Picture: Amanda Holden/Instagram)

Amanda Holden understandably looks downcast in her first photo since having surgery after breaking her leg in two places.

The Britain’s Got Talent judge suffered a nasty fall while playing with her children in the sea on holiday in Europe, and snapped her fibula in two places requiring surgery.

In her first Instagram post since the incident, Amanda is seen lying on a sun lounger with her bandaged right leg resting up.

Although slightly glammed up with a pretty sundress and perfectly straightened hair, it’s clear Amanda’s in no mood as she gave a thumbs down to the camera.

She quipped in the caption: ‘Heart Break fast ! #leg.’

Amanda was flooded with well wishes from fans and her celebrity pals, including Lucy-Jo Hudson who commented: ‘Ah no sending you all my love.’

Pointing out her flawless look, Kelly Hoppen said: ‘I’ll decorate it for you Saturday still looking stylish as ever.’

Jenni Falconer chimed in: ‘Oh nooooo. Sending lots of love,’ while Celebrity Juice host Keith Lemon said in shock: ‘No way!!!!’

It comes after Amanda, 48, detailed the incident on Monday night after the news broke of the accident.

‘Sadly this is true. I suffered a nasty accident while playing in the sea with the family during our half-term holiday and subsequently broke my leg in two places,’ she said.

‘I had an operation on Friday and a metal plate was fitted.’

Amanda called into her Heart co-host Jamie Theakston on Tuesday morning to reveal exactly how the painful incident unfolded.

And it was all because she was simply trying to be a good mum.

Amanda was just trying to be a good mum (Picture: Amanda Holden/Instagram)

‘So basically I was trying to be a good mother and I put my book down, I put down the Uno cards… and I said to Hollie, “Mummy can come on that with you” and there’s this like, you remember [Total] Wipeout, that TV thing? There’s like a children’s Total Wipeout thing in the middle of the sea and … mistily get round it and I thought yeah I can do that, so Hollie was doing brilliantly and going round it,’ Amanda said.

She continued: ‘I walked around it and then crawled across like an old person, like across the difficult bits.

‘And then there were these three inflatable stepping stones in the middle of the sea and everyone else was running across it and I thought, “Oh I could do that, if kids can do it I can do it,” and I did it and I made it – I was showing off Jamie – I made it across to the other side and then my leg slipped because obviously it’s wet, like an inflatable thing in the sea, my leg slipped and it went the other way and I felt it break and I fell into the sea and I had to swim back to the shore one-legged.’

A source had previously told The Sun: ‘She lost her footing while climbing on an inflatable assault course with her daughter and fell into the sea.

‘After receiving urgent medical attention at a hospital, Amanda just wants to be at home and in her own bed where she can rest up.’

Nothing is keeping Amanda down though as she is expected to return to work on her Heart Radio breakfast show on Monday.

‘Despite this painful accident it’s business as usual for Amanda and she will return to Heart Breakfast on Monday 28th October,’ the station confirmed in a statement.
